title: Help in converting GPA to 4 scale
content:
Hello Folks,

I'm currently applying for graduate studies in computer science and I needed some advice on how to convert my 10-scale GPA to 4-scale. I know that while applying, we must report GPA in the original scales, but I only need the conversion as I'm shortlisting unis for Fall'24 and I'm comparing my GPA against the GPA of admits in GradCafe. Since GradCafe reports GPA in a 4-scale, I will have to convert my GPA to 4-scale to appropriately compare.

I'm currently using scholaro's GPA calculator and have entered the credits and corresponding grades. But, something seems to be off as it's reporting a cumulative GPA of **3.9**/4 when my CGPA is **9.03**/10. And my CGPA is definitely very average when compared to the my rest of my cohort where average GPA is around **9.3** 

Now, I'm confused if **3.9** is really my converted GPA and should I use this while comparing GPAs in GradCafe ?? So, it would help me a lot if anyone can let me know my converted GPA (just a rough estimate) so that I can shortlist unis aptly.

**PFA**

&#x200B;

&#x200B;

https://preview.redd.it/gjuy2eyyylpa1.png?width=752&format=png&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=98623b798863a7889e0a0e1fd9d5f246688a4873

comments.body:
Did you just say 9.03 is average? 

* Cries in the corner *

But yes as far as I know, that's more or less accurate since you're scaling it down. Ideally you should also shortlist based on other factors since your GPA is only a minor component that makes your application. Highest GPA doesn't always make it through here.

Thanks a lot for your reply !! Yes, in my batch, average GPA is around 9.3. And my GPA is below-average.

But, in this [yocket link](https://yocket.com/blog/how-to-convert-10-point-cgpa-to-4-point-gpa) and other sources, it's given that 9 corresponds to around 3.68. That's the reason I got confused.

Yeah, I'm considering other factors and shortlisting holistically. But, the exact converted GPA would help me make better decisions. 

So, is it safe to assume that **3.9** is my converted GPA and go ahead with that?

Your batch’s average gpa was 9.3?

What the fuck man. There’s no value to getting 9 in pes then

Are you sure your scholero settings are correct? I had to do this when I applied and the scholero gpa I reported was lower than yours but I had a higher CGPA. 

After you select the drop down that corresponds to the best grade you should put in the same letter grades (so S, A, B etc. No A+ or anything like that)

First, I tried to select the PESU Grading scale. But, this feature is available only for premium users and the button to calculate GPA is disabled. [PFA](https://imgur.com/a/UDJybcY)

So, I ended up choosing the UCG 10-point scale ([PFA](https://imgur.com/a/fiiVJZq)) in which I mapped our grades (S,A,B,C) to (O,A+,A,B). Is this the correct way to do it ? 

If not, can give please give me a rough estimate of my GPA **9.03** to 4-scale (I have all S and A except for a couple of Bs and one C ).

  

**Thanks a lot**
Also, can I please DM you regarding some other query ?
I think the VIT one was what I used. Or maybe Anna University or Mumbai University. One of those should do the job
Which batch are you from? afaik no batch has average gpa that high. The closest thing is the current 6th sem CS where 33% got 9 or higher sgpa last sem, but even there cgpa is lower.
